channel.title: Projects on Asrar Ahmed
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Asrar Ahmed

item.title: Predicting False 911 Calls
item.description: False 911 calls are not only a waste of resources but take away from real emergencies. In this binary classification model, I analyzed a log of approximately 300,000 911 Emergency phone calls made in the city of San Francisco in 2018 from this website. The dataset consisted of mostly categorical features with high cardinality and the target class was highly imbalanced. After cleaning the dataset, I obtained an understanding of the relationship between features by means of visualization and statistical measures (chi-squared, R2 ).

item.title: Customer Analytics
item.description: In order for any business to thrive, the enterprise has to maximize revenue by understanding their customer base. In this exercise, I employed the Segregation, Targeting and Positioning (“STP”) Marketing Mix framework in analyzing the customer base of a fictional supermarket. I segregated the customer population into four clusters using Kmeans, an unsupervised learning model. After going over the demographic composition of each cluster and labeling them (High Income, Upper Middle Class, Lower Middle Class, Low Income), I analyzed each customer segment’s purchase behavior, including the:

item.title: Text Analysis of the annual State of the Union address
item.description: To obtain an appreciation of the vision of the nation held by contemporary U.S. presidents, part of the analysis must include an examination of their formal speeches. In this project, I analyzed each State of the Union(“SoTU”) address given by U.S. presidents for the past 40 years (Since Ronald Reagan in 1980 to Donald Trump in 2020). I web-scraped the annual State of the Union speeches from this website. Then, after doing some cleaning and digging, some of the questions I answered included:
